result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Lemay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bail applied to fine.  Paid in full.  Any remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
Restitution in the amount of $49.99 to be paid to Officer Condon.  Bail applied to restitution.  Paid in full.

Straight time commencing FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 8 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A Lemay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott A Lemay in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #2. 

Sentence of:
60 Days Jail without Huber.  (Credit - 8 days) commences immediately.  Concurrent to any other sentence. 
Restitution: $49.99 to be paid to Officer Condon, Bail to be applied from case #15CM1233. 
FINE:  $379.000 Bail to be applied from case #15CM1233.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott A Lemay
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail,   (Effective: 10-15-2015)
Prior: 401 North Greenfield Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant Scott A Lemay in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario makes statements.  Court sets this case for a pleas, but leaves the matter on for trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing on October 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Lemay in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds Attorney Rosario is counsel of record on both cases 15CM964 and 15CM1233.  Attorney Rosario didn't have the file 15CM1233.  Criminal complaint in 15CM1233 given to Attorney Rosario in Court.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Lemay in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Scott A Lemay in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
